title: PACOM Robberies between 2009 and 2011 (Completed) GEO
name: PACOM Robberies between 2009 and 2011 (Completed) GEO
description: This data and map presents robberies committed by the Communist Party of India-Maoist group between 2009 and 2011.

properties.event summary: 02/13/2009: On Friday evening, twenty Communist Party of India- Maoist militants robbed the Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL) cellular and wireless in local loop (WLL) phones from the residents of Churhatpat village in Balrampur, Chhattisgarh, India. No casualties were reported.
properties.event title: CPI- Maoists Rob Villagers of Cell Phones in Balrampur

properties.event summary: 02/18/2009: On Wednesday, Communist Party of India-Maoist militants attacked a building of local government's forestry department, ransacking it and stealing two guns, a pistol, and INR 100,000, in the Phulbani area of Kandhamal, Orissa, India. No casualties were reported. Forty CPI-Maoist militants were involved in the robbery.
properties.event title: CPI-Maoist Rob Forestry Building in Kandhamal

properties.event summary: 03/29/2009: On Sunday, around 0100, about 25 Communist Party of India- Maoist militants looted tourists and forest range offices, leaving with eight rifles and VHF communication sets, in the Similipal Tiger Project (STP) in Mayurbhanj, Orissa, India. No casualties were reported.
properties.event title: CPI-Maoists Loot Tourists in Mayurbhanj

properties.event summary: On 4/26/2009, CPI-M rebels looted 100 quintals of rice, 100 quintals of wheat, 10 quintals of potato and onions, and jewelry from a farmer in Chonha village, Gaya district.
properties.event title: CPI-M rebels seize food and jewels from farmer in Gaya

properties.event summary: On 6/16/2009, CPI-M rebels allegedly attacked members of the Election Commission (EC) during first phase elections in Malkangiri district, Orissa state.  A cash amount of INR 6,954, four mobile handsets, and a mobile charger were seized.  The CPI-M issued an apology for the attack, claiming that the incidents will not happen again.
properties.event title: CPI-M rebels attack EC officials in Malkangiri

properties.event summary: 10/20/2009: On Tuesday, at 1320 hrs, during an attack on a police station, Communist Party of India Maoists also robbed a bank. 22 CPI-Maoists, lead by a female militant in her early 20s, came from the Durgahuri forest riding eleven motorcycles. The Maoists divided into two groups and entered the police station carrying at least two automatic weapons each. The attack occured in West Midnapore's Sankrail, just 70 km from the Midnapore town. The attack lasted about 40 minutes. The Maoists shot and killed sub-inspector Dibakar Bhattacharjee (58) and sub-inspector Swapan Roy. Sub-inspector Sukhendu Masanto claimed that he lead the rebels to a locked trunk and wooden box where six .303 rifles and five pistols had been kept. The Maoists broke it open with a rifle butt and grabbed the weapons. Masanto was let go after having to do squats holding his ears. During the attack, the Maoists robbed the SBI branch of a bank. A cashier, Sujit Das, was fired upon by the Maoists but remained unharmed. Das was forced to open the vault and the rebels took about Rs 9.72 lakh. The Maoists also booby-trapped the road on both sides of the police station and planted an improvised explosive device along NH-6 (National Highway-6).Leaving at about 1400 hrs, the Maoists then grabbed two Hero Honda motorcycles from the police station and officer-in-charge Atindranath Dutta (35). Maoist leader Kishenji told a TV channel that all women Maoist cadres should be released in exchange for Dutta's freedom, and that the killings were in retaliation for the security forces' operation in Lalgarh. "We also want to pass on the message that we are ready for any new offensive, like the one the Centre is planning."
properties.event title: CPI-Maoists Attack Police Station and Rob a Bank; Midnapore, India.

properties.event summary: 05/21/2009: On Thursday, weapons and ammunition were stolen from police officers in Tawitola, Gadchiroli, Maharashtra, India. No group claimed responsibility, but it was widely believed the Communist Party of India-Maoist (CPI-Maoist) was responsible.
properties.event title: Wepons and Ammunition Stolen from Police in Tawitola, India

properties.event summary: 11/10/2009: On Tuesday, early in the morning, Maoists rancsacked the rest-shed of a construction company near the MV-77 village in an effort to hinder the construction of rural roads to the hinterland. The militants caused no casualties.
properties.event title: Construction Company Ransacked in Orissa

properties.event summary: 07/16/2009:  On Thursday, in Champajharan, Sundargarh, Orissa, India, when approximately 30 assailants fired upon a vehicle transporting explosives and a police escort van, damaging both vehicles and stealing the explosives.
properties.event title: Explosives Stolen in Armed Attack

properties.event summary: 02/22/2010: On Monday, in Kalapathar village in Chakulia block of East Singhbhum District, Maoist militants looted the house of a ration dealer, Ramdas Soren, for being a suspected police informer. No casualties were reported.
properties.event title: Maoists Militants Loot the House of a Ration Leader

properties.event summary: 02/15/2010: On Monday, after a military camp was fired on and set on fire, Bengal police found that arms and ammunition were looted by rebels.
properties.event title: Arms and Ammunition Looted

properties.event summary: 03/23/2010: On Tuesday at an unspecified time, in Belsand, Sitamarhi District, Bihar, India, Maoists ransacked the LPG godown of a Parliamentarian, Anwarul Haque and looted INR 172,000. The Maoists also opened fire on the police party and the Police returned 10 rounds of fire. No casualties or damage were reported. No group claimed responsibility.
properties.event title: Maoists Ransacked the LPG Godown of a Parliamentarian

properties.event summary: 08/26/2010: On Friday, in the village of Tilauthar, Bihar, India, after attacking a police station, 100 assailants robbed 12 truck drivers and set fire to 12 vehicles, no casualties were reported. No group has claimed responsibility, but Communist Party of India-Maoist (CPI-Maoist) militants were thought responsible for the attack.
properties.event title: One Hundred Assailants Rob Drivers and Set Fire to Vehicles in Bihar's Tilauthar

properties.event summary: 09/09/2010: On Thursday, in Imamganj, Gaya, Bihar, India, around 400 militants looted jewelry and other valuables worth INR 5 million after burning down several houses. Cadres of the Communist Party of India-Maoist were responsible.
properties.event title: Jewelry Looted in Gaya

properties.event summary: 04/23/2010: On Friday morning, in the Malkangiri district of Orissa, India, roughly 50 Communist Party of India (Maoist) militants broke into and vandalized a liquor shop, causing damage worth four lakhs Indian Rupee (8775 U.S dollars). They also stole Rs 90,000 (1974 U.S. dollars) from the store. The CPI (Maoist) claimed responsibility.
properties.event title: CPI (Maoist) Militants Responsible for Liquor Store Robbery in Orissa, India

properties.event summary: 07/17/2010:  On Saturday evening, assailants robbed the victim's house and stole belongings valued at 20,000 rupees. The Communist Party of India-Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility.
properties.event title: Kidnappers Rob Victims House

properties.event summary: 08/28/2010:  On Saturday at an unknown time, hostages had their cell phones stolen at a construction site in Patan, Bihar, India on 08/28/2010.
properties.event title: Cell Phones Stolen From Construction Site

properties.event summary: 06/02/2011: On Thursday, six Maoists attempted to look a State Bank of India (SBI) branch at Marhu in Khunti District of Jharkhand, India. No casualties were reported.
properties.event title: Six Maoists Attempt to Loot a State Bank of India Branch

properties.event summary: 01/12/2009: On Monday, a police vehicle was hijacked and stolen by Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-M) militants in the Yashodhara Nagar area of Nagpur in the Indian state of Maharashtra. There were no reports of any casualties in the attack.
properties.event title: CPI-M Hijacked Police Vehicle in Maharashtra

properties.event summary: 07/30/2011: On Saturday, in Malkangiri, India, a group of around 100 suspected Maoists, 25 of whom were armed, targeted the house of a person whom they alleged to be illegally selling liquor. The house was ransacked. CPI-Maoists claimed responsibility and left behind handwritten posters through which they threatened dire consequences for anyone who would promote liquor in the area.
properties.event title: Maoists Target House of Illegal Liquor Sales in Malkangiri, India

properties.event summary: 06/07/2011: On Tuesday, in Nagpur, Maharashtra, India, two suspected Maoists robber a railway gateman at his post between Bakal and Rajnandgaon railway stations. The militants took cash, a phone and a bike.
properties.event title: Maoists Robbed a Railway Station in Nagpur, Maharashtra, India

properties.event summary: 10/11/2011: On Tuesday night, in Munagapdar village, Gariaband, Chhattisgarh, India, a group of suspected Communist Party of India-Maoists stole a revolver from Damrudhar Pujari. No casualties were reported during the robbery.
properties.event title: Suspected Maoists Militants Steal Gun from Damrudhar Pujari in Munagapdar village, Gariaband, Chhattisgarh, India
